revised_title: Bile Acids and Their Compounds: Antibacterial Properties and Surface Activity
tldr: This study investigates the antibacterial properties of bile acids and their compounds, focusing on their bacteriostatic and bactericidal effects on various microorganisms. The authors found that bile acids' antibacterial properties are related to their high surface activity and hydrophobic-hydrophilic structure. They also discovered that certain bile derivatives with strong solvent action on the Gram-positive complex have a particularly strong antibacterial action.
